column4: i is booting 4 o/s. i wish to delete one. what troubles will i have ? like with MBR/grub or anything else ?
!wine
i is booting 4 o/s. i wish to delete one. what troubles will i have ? like with MBR/grub or anything else ?
just don't delete the partition where the grub files are in :)
and QTParted will do the trick for deleting a partition ?
think so though I have never used it
any orther suggestions for a program that i can have a look see for this job ?
I usually use fdisk to delete, but parted or any other can do it
you are not trying to resize are you?
thank you for your help and input
yes/no/maybe i wood like to delete a partiton and add that to another partition with a o/s on it. can this be done ?
if the partition you are adding is after the partition with the OS it might work
as the superbloc has to be in the start of the partition
partiton is before.
than you probably will have trouble joining them
more trouble thans it's worth then ? no rush here | i will do some reading on this matter
most partitions can be increased by pulling the end, I don't think you can mess witht he start
but maybe there are ways I don't know about :)
maybe there is a way to have a partition jump over to the rear of a nother partition :-)
you don't seem to have a boot partition. If it is only data you could send all the files to another place and delete both partitions to make a big one.
and then copy the data back
